cause.description:
Laurel House was founded in 1980 by nine women from the Women’s Center of Montgomery County as a safe haven for women and children fleeing violence in the home. Throughout the years, the organization has grown to include a 24-hour hotline, twelve units of transitional housing, and numerous other supportive services for people and communities throughout the county.
1. Laurel House is dedicated to the vision of ending domestic violence.
cause.mission: provide safe haven for abused women and their children, to raise public awareness about domestic violence and to advocate for social change against domestic violence.
cause.name: Laurel House
